manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: This module allows user to optimize MIDP applications using JODE optimizer. The optimizer binary itself must be downloaded separately.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The J2ME Wireless module helps you write programs that use J2ME MIDP profile. It includes a MIDP wizard and MIDP templates, either of which can generate most of the code needed for MIDP programs. It also includes an emulator integration which allows you to test the developed application and compilation which handles all complexity of preverification.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Enables dynamic updating of IDE through the Update Center.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The Auto Update module enables the IDE to connect to the Update Center server, download updated and new modules, and automatically install the modules.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: used to troubleshoot and submit Bug Reports through the IDE.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The Bug Submitter is designed to simplify capturing and submiting a bug report using HTTP or SMTP.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Support for creating JavaBeans(TM) components.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The Bean Patterns module provides support for developing JavaBeans(TM) components in the IDE, such as generation of properties, event sets, and BeanInfo.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: The module provides very basic support for CSS editing.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The module provides very basic support for CSS editing. CSS documents can be opened in text editor with syntax coloring. There is a syntax check action.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Library which calculates class closures.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: This module is part of the J2EE Building Blocks support. It is a library which calculates class closures.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Provides read-only access to Java class files.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The Classfile Reader module provides direct read-only access to Java class files, showing all of a class's members and attributes.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Supports work with Java class files without source.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The Sourceless Java Classes module enables you to work with class files that are without their corresponding source file. It also supports serialized JavaBeans components.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Integration of ClearCase command-line interface into generic VCS support.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The ClearCase Command Line Support Profile module enables you to use ClearCase command-line interface as a version control system within the IDE through generic VCS support.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Part of the core supporting compilation.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: Adds support for compilation into the platform. Contains classeswhich implement the compilation part of APIs and resources forexecution user interface and settings.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Implementations of deprecated APIs.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: A few classes needed for compatibility with users of deprecated APIs. Normally not needed at runtime.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Deprecation-Message: The Deprecated Core module is primarily used to support the Deprecated APIs module. Users of org.netbeans.core.ModuleInstaller should switch to org.netbeans.core.modules.TestModuleDeployer.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Implementation of the Execution engine.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: Adds support for execution into the platform. Contains classes which implement the execution part of APIs and resources for theUI of compilation an it's settings.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: The IDE's basic infrastructure for debugging.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The Debugger Core module provides the basic infrastructure in the IDE for debugging. Modules for specific debugger implementations are based on this module.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Makes the IDE from the platform.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: Adds classes and resources usefull for building IDEs on top of the platform.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Output Window implementation.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: Provides the NetBeans Output Window.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: A library for storing settings in custom formats.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: This module provides the Settings API for storing module-defined settings in custom formats. It also provides several useful settings format implementations.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: User interface of the platform.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: Provides classes and resources for the standard basic user interface ofthe platform and for applications build on top of the platform.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Implementation for windowing support.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: Adds classes implementing the window system part of the APIs.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: The basic core framework of the IDE.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: This module provides the central infrastructure that causes the IDE to exist as an application. This module cannot be disabled.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Integration of command-line CVS client into generic VCS support.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The CVS Command Line Support Profile module enables you to use command-line CVS client as a version control system within the IDE through generic VCS support.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Disables the redundant CVS mount action in the Versioning menu.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: This module disables the redundant CVS mount action in the Versioning menu. This is to ensure that only the command-line version of the CVS interface is available when creating new filesystem mount points. The javacvs module is not fully functional and is not supported with Sun ONE Studio. New filesystems should be created with the Generic VCS/CVS profile. Old mount points using javacvs should continue to work.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Views and modifies the structure of the connected database.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: Uses the Explorer to view the current structure of the connected database tables and their data while you are developing database applications or applets within the IDE.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Enables you to capture and view the structure of a database in the IDE.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: Enables you to create a database structure snapshot that you can use in the IDE.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Support for groups of files.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The Group module provides support for groups of files.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Enables debugging with the JPDA debugger implementation.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The JPDA Debugger module enables you to debug applications using the Java Platform Debugging Architecture.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The Diff module provides an action, that is enabled when two files are selected in the IDE. It is based on an external diff utility, that is executed to obtain the differences, which are then shown to the user graphically.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Enables editing of files in the IDE.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The Editor module enables you to edit source files within the IDE. It provides syntax coloring for Java and HTML files, word matching, code completion, and other basic and advanced features.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Support for building Enterprise Java Beans.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: This module is part of the J2EE Building Blocks support. It allows users to build Enterprise Java Bean Components.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: This nbm holds the S1S Examples.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The External Browser module enables the integration of external web browsers with the IDE for viewing Javadoc documentation and testing applets and web (JSP and servlet) applications. It provides an alternative to using the built-in HTML Browser.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Enables you to copy files to and from a remote FTP server.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The File Copy module enables you to copy files to a local folder or to a remote FTP server.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Supports visual design of AWT and Swing applications.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The mapping core is automatically loaded by other Transparent Persistence modules. It provides core mapping support for the other modules.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Support for Tool Designer modules
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: This module is part of Tool Designer. It provides a framework from which all Tool Designer modules are built. It is itself a programmatically configurable general purpose module.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Supports creation, editing, and viewing of HTML files.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The HTML module supports creation and editing of HTML files and enables you to view them in a web browser.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Provides infrastructure for testing applets, RMI applications, and so on.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The HTTP Server module provides the infrastructure necessary for a variety of tasks, such as testing applets, testing RMI and JINI applications, and viewing Javadoc documentation in the external web browser.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Enables internationalization of files created with the IDE's Form Editor.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The Internationalization of Form module enables you to internationalize visual forms that you create in the IDE's Form Editor.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Simplifies internationalization of applications.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The Internationalization module, combined with the Properties module, simplifies internationalization of Java applications. It includes a wizard, which enables you to internationalize all of your Java at once, a test tool, which reports any missing key-value pairs, and an execution service, which enables you to set the locale in which the application is to run.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Supports viewing of image files.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The Image module provides support for viewing image files in the IDE. It includes zoom and grid functions.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Import of J2EE Enterprise Archive Files.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The import module gives the user the ability to import into the IDE a J2EE application developed externally. The user can then continue development of the application using the J2EE support modules.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The j2eeserver module enables J2EE development modules to configure, deploy, and debug J2EE components on J2EE application servers that have a server plugin module using the server integration api.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Enables you to create and update JAR recipies.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The JAR Packager module enables you to manage recipes for creating JAR files from files located in directories mounted in the IDE.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: APIs for Java development support modules
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: Allows other modules to use services provided by Java module.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Serves as a model for the structure of Java source files.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: Contains the org.openide.src.* API packages which model Java source files, and also class files.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Supports work with Java source files.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The Java Source Files module enables the IDE for development in Java Language. It delivers three Java compilers and allows to execute Java classes. It also provides visual representation of Java source structure in the Explorer and property sheets for inspecting or altering field, method and class declarations. In addition it provides these features: - templates for a main class, exception, interface and a generic class - Wizard for easy and fast creation of new classes - when an interface changes, suggests necessary updates to implementing classes - tool for easy overriding of methods - customizers for fields, methods or classes ... and many more. From version 1.11: - error checking on background and error markers visible in the code editor From version 1.10: - ability to make clever project builds, when some of classes change. Javamake tool is used to track and analyze the changes. From version 1.7: - supports different encodings for individual source files - support for `assert' keyword introduced in JDK-1.4 From version 1.6: - tool for managing import statements
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Module-Dependencies: org.netbeans.api.java/1, org.netbeans.modules.classfile/1, org.openide/1 > 3.42.2.0.1, org.openide.src > 1.0, org.openide.compiler > 1.0, org.openide.execution > 1.0, org.openide.debugger > 1.0

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: A CVS client that works without a separate CVS executable.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The Built-in CVS Client module is a CVS client that enables you to use the CVS version control system within the IDE without a separate CVS executable. You can work with CVS working directories and call CVS commands within the IDE. The Built-in CVS Client module currently does not support local connections.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Supports Javadoc creation and searches.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The Javadoc module enables you to search and browse Javadoc documentation from within the IDE and helps you create Javadoc comments in your source code.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Permits JavaHelp help sets to be added to the IDE.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: Contains the actual JavaHelp runtime library, and the implementation of the part of the Modules API which permits other modules to install help sets using JavaHelp.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: The module ensures full JAXP 1.1 implementation will be available.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The module ensures full JAXP 1.1 implementation will be available. Extends NetBeans JAXP/parsers support and JAXP/transform is accessible.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: JAX-R libraries
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: This module presents the JAX-R libraries as useful libraries in the IDE.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: JAX-RPC libraries
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: This module presents the JAX-RPC libraries as useful libraries in the IDE.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: JDBC Tabs and Swing component and wizards to create the database application.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: You can use the IDE's JDBC Tab and Swing components to create a JDBC application. Once you have used the IDE to create the application code, you can further edit the code you have generated. Part of the JDBC module is a JDBC Form Wizard, which enables you to perform many of the tasks that you can also do from the JDBC tab. Once you finish running the wizard, you will have a generated application, a file name for the application, and a package.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: J2EE application assembly support for Web modules.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The J2EE application assembly support for Web modules provides support for adding of Web Modules into J2EE application using application assembler.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Name: Web module support for J2EE assembling

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Supports the debugging of JSP

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: JSP/Servlet depl. descriptor editing enables to view and easyly edit elements from web.xml file in editors accessible from property sheets.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Module-Dependencies: org.netbeans.modules.web.ie/1 > 1.5, org.netbeans.modules.web.core/1 > 1.14, org.netbeans.modules.html/1, org.netbeans.modules.j2eeserver/2, com.sun.forte4j.j2ee.lib/1 > 1.2, org.netbeans.modules.schema2beans/1, org.openidex.util/2, org.openide.src > 1.0

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Provides advanced web application development features.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The advanced JSP/servlet module provides support for authoring custom JSP tag libraries, monitoring running web applications, and debugging JavaServer Pages on the source code level. It also supports visual editing of web application deployment descriptors and packaging of .war files. In addition, it includes ready-to-use tag libraries for presentation, database development, and Transparent Persistence.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Module-Dependencies: org.netbeans.modules.web.core/1 > 1.14, org.netbeans.modules.jarpackager/2, org.netbeans.modules.debugger.jpda/1 > 1.11, org.netbeans.modules.xml.catalog/2 > 0.9, org.netbeans.modules.j2eeserver/2, org.netbeans.modules.schema2beans/1, org.netbeans.modules.html/1, org.openidex.util/2, org.netbeans.core/1 > 1.0, org.openide.src > 1.0, org.openide.execution > 1.0

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Creates and executes tests suitable for JUnit framework.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: JUnit module allows you to create and execute test classes suitable for JUnit framework.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: JWSDP - Java Web Services Developer Pack
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: A set of libraries for creating and using web services.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: kSOAP runtime library from Lutris.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: A bundled version of the kSOAP runtime library from Lutris. Serves as a SOAP runtime for KVM devices.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Module for managing installed serial numbers
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: Module for managing installed serial numbers

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: The TraceLogger library and module.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: Allows you to dynamically change the settings of the TraceLogger, including adding log files after startup. Also includes NbTraceErrorManager, which can be used as a replacement for the default ErrorManager.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: The JavaMail API provides a set of abstract classes that model a mail system.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The JavaMail API provides a set of abstract classes that model a mail system. The API provides a platform independent and protocol independent framework to build Java technology-based mail and messaging applications.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Tracks data flow inside the servlet engine
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The HTTP Monitor is a tool for debugging web applictions. It records data about the HTTP requests processed by the server and also allows these requests to be replayed.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: The Compiler API and associated classes.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The org.openide.compiler.* API package, as well as compilation-related actions, CompilerCookie, and CompilerSupport.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: The original Debugger API from the Open APIs.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: A simple API for controlling basic aspects of debugging. Likely to be replaced in the future with a more comprehensive API, but available for compatibility purposes in the meantime.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Old Open APIs which should be avoided.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: Contains classes from various Open APIs packages which should no longer be used, as they violate proper separation of the APIs into domains.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Deprecation-Message: Clients of obsoleted Open APIs are encouraged to remove this dependency. See https://netbeans.org/download/dev/javadoc/OpenAPIs/org/openide/doc-files/upgrade.html#3.5i-sep

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Execution API from the Open APIs.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: Consists of the org.openide.execution.* package from the Open APIs, as well as ExecCookie, ArgumentsCookie, ExecuteAction, and ExecutionSupport.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Open APIs relating to displaying output.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: Contains classes from org.openide.windows.* relating to creating output tabs, displaying output, and hyperlinking it.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: The NetBeans Open APIs.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: This pseudo-module represents the Open APIs (org.openide.*), which are used by all other NetBeans modules.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Experimental API extensions used by various modules.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: This module provides various extensions to the APIs, which other modules rely on, but it does not provide any user-visible features. Note: the APIs provided in this module are considered experimental and can be changed in a backward incompatible way without notice.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: The module contains simple XSL support.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The module contains simple XSL support including XSL Transformation action.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Map CMP beans to database schema
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The mapping ejb module supports mapping CMP container-managed fields and container-managed relationships to database schema.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: The PointBase module provides database management of the PointBase ORDBMS and administration tools.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The PointBase module provides the PointBase Object Relational Database Management System, providing database management system technology for you to use in building your applications with the IDE, and, in addition, tools that can help you administer the PointBase database.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Support for organizing development work into projects.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The Projects module enables you to create a view of files specifically relevant to your project, compile all project files at once, and specify the main class when you run your project.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Syntax coloring for .properties files in the source editor.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The Resource Bundle Syntax Coloring module provides syntax coloring in the source editor for .properties files.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Supports editing of .properties files.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The Resource Bundles module provides support for browsing .properties files in the Explorer and editing them in the Source Editor or in a table view.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Integration of PVCS Version Manager command-line interface into generic VCS support.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The PVCS Command Line Support Profile module enables you to use PVCS Version Manager command-line interface as a version control system within the IDE through generic VCS support.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: The Registration module enables users to register their product for updates and support.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The Registration module enables users to register their product for updates and support.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Library for representing XML as java beans.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: XML data binding generator. This module is a library of support classes for generating beans corresponding to XML descriptors.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Servlet 2.2 API Library
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: Servlet 2.2 API Library

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Servlet 2.3 API Library
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: Servlet 2.3 API Library

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: SOAP Runtime from the Apache group.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: A bundled version of the SOAP runtime from the Apache group. Serves as a library for some modules such as the Java Web Services Designer.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: A terminal emulator library written in Java.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: A pure-Java terminal emulator capable of handling usual cursor control sequences, scrolling, selection, copying, redirection of output, and so on. Used in NetBeans for the Output Window.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Enables the IDE to work with text files.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The Text module enables the IDE to recognize files with the .txt extension so that you can work with them in the Source Editor.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Supports compilation of JSPs in the IDE.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: This module allows calling the IDE from the server to compile JSPs in the IDE. This enables debugging of JSP pages.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Supports testing web applications with the Tomcat server.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: This module allows developing and executing web applications with the Tomcat server. Tomcat is bundled with the IDE, so no additional configuration is necessary. Also allows configuring the bundled Tomcat.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Module-Dependencies: org.netbeans.modules.j2eeserver/2, org.netbeans.modules.web.core/1 > 1.8, org.netbeans.modules.schema2beans/1, org.netbeans.modules.servletapi23/1, org.netbeans.modules.web.jspparser/1 > 1.2, org.netbeans.modules.debugger.core/3, org.openide.src > 1.0, org.netbeans.modules.java/1, org.openide.compiler > 1.0, org.openide.execution > 1.0, org.openide.io > 1.0, org.openide.debugger > 1.0

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Online documentation for the IDE.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The General Online Help module provides online and context-sensitive documentation for basic IDE features such as browsing and editing files; compiling, running, debugging, and internationalizing applications; and using version control inside of the IDE.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Support for file searching, bookmarks.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The User Utilities module provides miscellaneous pieces of functionality such as support for URLs (bookmarks), and file searching. It also provides the open file feature, which helps you open a file in a previously unmounted filesystem.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Provides basis for integration of version control systems.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The VCS Core module provides basic structure and libraries on which support modules for various version control systems can be based. The CVS and JavaCVS modules both depend on the VCS Core module.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Converts the CVS filesystems from unsupported vcscvs module to vcsgeneric module. Supports use of command-line CVS in the IDE.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The converter of CVS Command-Line Client Support filesystems comming from unsupported vcscvs module to the newly supported CVS profiles of vcsgeneric module. Needed for successful imports of projects containing command line CVS file systems from NetBeans 3.2.1 and older, Forte 3.0 and older.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Enables you to integrate any version control system that has a command-line interface.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The VCS Generic Support module enables you to integrate any version control system that has a command-line interface (such as CVS, RCS, or SCCS) into the IDE. The module also comes with configurations for PVCS and Visual Source Safe, which you can use as is or customize. You can get additional configurations from http://vcsgeneric.netbeans.org/profiles/index.html.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Integration of VSS command-line interface into generic VCS support.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The VSS Command Line Support Profile module enables you to use Visual Source Safe command-line interface as a version control system within the IDE through generic VCS support.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Supports the creation, editing, compiling, and testing of JavaServer Pages.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The JSP module supports the creation, editing, compiling, and testing of JavaServer Pages (JSPs). Features include syntax coloring and code completion, easy JSP validation inside the IDE, and the preview of applications in a web browser.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Module-Dependencies: org.netbeans.modules.java/1,org.netbeans.modules.debugger.core/3, org.netbeans.modules.j2eeserver/2, org.netbeans.modules.schema2beans/1, org.netbeans.modules.html/1, org.netbeans.modules.jarpackager/2, org.openidex.util/2, org.netbeans.api.xml/1, org.openide.src > 1.0, org.openide.compiler > 1.0, org.openide.execution > 1.0, org.openide.io > 1.0, org.netbeans.core/1 > 1.0, org.openide.debugger > 1.0, org.netbeans.modules.projects/1 > 1.12.1

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Provides support for parsing JSP files using the Jakarta JSP parser.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The JSP Parser module provides parsing capability for JSP files. Anthough it does not have a visible user interface, it is used internally for implementation of JSP Syntax Coloring and Code Completion features, as well as for JSP compilation.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Provides syntax coloring for JSP files in the Source Editor.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The JSP Syntax Coloring module provides syntax coloring in the source editor for Java Server Pages.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Module-Dependencies: org.netbeans.modules.web.core/1 > 1.6, org.netbeans.modules.editor/1 > 1.6, org.netbeans.modules.servletapi23/1, org.openide.execution > 1.0, org.netbeans.modules.xml.text/2 = XMLr35

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Supports the creation of JSP custom tag libraries
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The JSP Tag Library Editor is a tool for creating of JSP custom tag libraries.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Module-Dependencies: org.netbeans.modules.web.core/1 > 1.14, org.netbeans.modules.jarpackager/2, org.netbeans.modules.xml.core/2 = XMLr35, org.netbeans.modules.servletapi/1, org.netbeans.api.java/1, org.openide.src > 1.0, org.openide.io > 1.0,

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Shows welcome content after the first startup of the IDE.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The Welcome module provides a screen with introductory information about using the IDE. The screen appears when you start the IDE for the first time. You can choose basic commands and open help topics directly from this screen.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Support for Web Services Description Language (WSDL) files.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: Support for Web Services Description Language (WSDL) files.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Module-Dependencies: org.netbeans.modules.jarpackager/2, org.netbeans.modules.schema2beans/1 > 1.2.1, org.netbeans.modules.java/1, org.openidex.util/2, com.sun.forte4j.j2ee.lib/1 > 1.2, org.netbeans.modules.xml.core/2 = XMLr35, org.netbeans.modules.logger/1, com.sun.xml.rpc/1, javax.activation/1, javax.mail/1, org.netbeans.api.java/1, org.openide.compiler > 1.0, org.openide.debugger > 1.0, org.openide.execution > 1.0

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: The module bundles Apache Xalan 2.3.1 (XSLT stylesheet processor).
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The module bundles Apache Xalan 2.3.1 (XSLT stylesheet processor), i.e. JAXP/transform 1.1 API implementation.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: The Apache group's XSLT processor.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: A bundled version of the Xalan XSLT processor (to manipulate XML stylesheets) from the Apache group. Serves as a library for some modules such as FFJ Web Services.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: This module bundles Apache Xerces 2.0.2 (XML parsers).
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: This module bundles Apache Xerces 2.0.2 (XML parsers), i.e. JAXP/parsers 1.1 API implementation.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: This module contains XML tools API and SPI.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: This module contains XML tools API. This module also offers SPI to support another API implementation plug in.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: The module allows to persistently mount entity catalogs.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The module allows to persistently mount entity catalogs. This implementation supports NetBeans native catalog and standard XML catalog. Module also offers SPI to support another catalog implementation plug in.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: The module is a base for all XML related modules.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The module is a base for all XML related modules. It recognizes XML and DTD documents, which can be opened in text editor. It supports parsing of those documents into TAX (Tree API for XML) representation. It supports synchronization among document representations. It also holds all settings shared among all XML related modules.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: The module provides support for XML Schema.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: User can validate XML Schemas using this module.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: The module contains Tree API for XML ("TAX") library.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The module contains Tree API for XML ("TAX") library. It allows tree manipulation of XML and DTD documents structure, including event, traversal and i/o support.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: The module provides text editing capabilities.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The module provides text editing capabilities. It adds syntax coloring, simple code completion, abbreviation support and simple indentation engine into text editing of XML and DTD documents.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: The module contains various actions, generators and tools.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The module contains various actions, generators and tools. Especially action to generate simple DTD from XML document, or wizard which generate SAX handler implementation according to selected DTD document.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Web Service Designer
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: This module helps in the building and deploying of Web Services.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Module-Dependencies: org.netbeans.modules.java/1, org.netbeans.modules.jarpackager/2, org.netbeans.modules.html/1, com.sun.forte4j.j2ee.ejb/1 > 1.2, com.sun.forte4j.j2ee.ejbmodule/1 > 1.2, org.netbeans.modules.logger/1, org.netbeans.modules.web.ie/1, org.netbeans.modules.web.core/1, org.apache.xalan > 2, com.sun.forte4j.modules.depclass/1 > 2.1, com.sun.forte4j.j2ee.lib/1 > 1.2, com.sun.forte4j.j2ee.appasm/1 > 1.2, org.netbeans.modules.j2eeserver/2, org.netbeans.modules.schema2beans/1 > 1.2.1, org.openidex.util/2, com.sun.forte4j.j2ee.wsdl/1 > 1.3, com.sun.forte4j.genericgenerator4/1, org.apache.soap, javax.mail/1, javax.activation/1, org.netbeans.modules.web.tomcat.tomcat40/1, org.netbeans.modules.servletapi23/1, org.netbeans.api.java/1, com.sun.xml.registry1, com.sun.xml.rpc/1, org.netbeans.modules.clazz/1, org.openide.src > 1.0, org.openide.execution > 1.0, org.openide.debugger > 1.0, org.openide.compiler > 1.0, org.openide.io > 1.0

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Helps you write programs that use CORBA technology.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The CORBA module helps you write programs that use CORBA technology. It provides a wizard and a set of templates, either of which can be used to generate most of the code needed for Java-language CORBA programs. A Naming Service browser is able to generate the code for naming service binding and lookup, while an Interface Repository Browser allows users to obtain interface definitions from a repository. Among other features, a GUI-based interactive POA Support and an Implementation Generator technology should be mentioned.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Module-Dependencies: org.openide.deprecated > 1.0, org.netbeans.modules.java/1, org.openide.compiler > 1.0, org.openide.execution > 1.0, org.openide.src > 1.0, org.netbeans.modules.projects/1

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Helps you write programs that use JNDI to access naming services technology.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The JNDI module helps you write programs that use JNDI to access naming services technology. Its main feature is a JNDI browser, which you can use to browse the contents of naming services. You can select a named item in the browser and generate binding or lookup code for it, which you can include in a program that needs to acess the naming service via JNDI.

manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Short-Description: Helps you write RMI programs with templates, a wizard, a registry browser, and an activation system browser.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Long-Description: The RMI module helps you write programs that use RMI technology. It includes an RMI wizard and RMI templates, either of which can generate most of the code needed for RMI programs. It also includes a RMI Registry browser, which generates the code for RMI registry binding and lookup, and an Activation System browser, which allows you to browse and customize activation system records and to generate the setup code for them.
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Requires: org.openide.util.HttpServer$Impl, org.netbeans.api.javahelp.Help, org.openide.TopManager, dataloader.group, org.openide.compiler.CompilationEngine, org.openide.execution.ExecutionEngine
manifest.OpenIDE-Module-Module-Dependencies: org.netbeans.modules.java/1 > 1.6, org.netbeans.modules.debugger.core/3, org.netbeans.modules.debugger.jpda/1 > 1.11, org.openide.deprecated > 1.2, org.openide.src > 1.0, org.openide.compiler > 1.0, org.openide.execution > 1.0, org.openide.debugger > 1.0

4. 限定保証 これらのモジュールは、Sun のお客様の便宜を図るためにのみ Sun が提供する ものです。Sun は、領収書の写しを証拠として購入日から 90 日間に限り、該 当する場合、モジュールが備え付けられたメディアが通常の使用の下では材質 および技量に瑕疵がないことを保証します。以上を除き、モジュールは現状の ままで提供されます。本限定保証の下でのお客様の唯一の救済方法および Sun の全責任として、モジュールのメディアの交換またはモジュールに対して支払 われた代金の払い戻しのいずれかの方法があり、これは Sun が任意に選択しま す。
5. 保証の否認 本契約書で特に規定されない限り、あらゆる明示的または黙示的条件、表明およ び保証は、これらの否認が法的に無効と見なされる場合を除き、商品性の黙示的 保証や特定目的適合性、非権利侵害性を含めてすべて否認されます。
6. 責任の限度 準拠法により許容される範囲内で、Sun またはそのライセンサーは、責任理論の いかんに拘わらず何に起因しようとも、またたとえ Sun がかかる損害の可能性 を予め忠告されていても、当モジュールの使用または使用不能によって生じた、 あるいは関連する収入や利益の損失、データの消失、特別、間接的、偶発的、付 随的もしくは懲罰的損害に対しても、一切責任を負わないものとします。いかな る場合も、Sun のお客様に対する責任は、契約、不法行為 (過失を含む)、もし くはその他の何であるかに拘わらず、本契約の下でモジュールに対してお客様が 支払われた金額を上限とします。以上の制限は、上述の保証がその本来の目的を 達成しない場合でも適用されます。上記条項のいずれかが準拠法違反、無効、も しくはいかなる権限においても執行不能とみなされる場合には、当該条項は本契 約がかかる権限の下で執行可能となるために必要な範囲まで放棄されるものとし ます。
7. 完全性 ソフトウェアの BCL を除き、本契約はモジュールに関するお客様と Sun との間 の合意の全てであり、当該事項に関する事前または同時になされたお客様と Sun との間の口頭または書面による協議、提案、表明よりに優先します。また、お客 様と Sun との間で交わされた契約内容に関する見積もり、注文、承認、または 同様の協議との間で、矛盾や非一貫性、追加条項がある場合、本契約が優先され ます。
